snippet: The agency had proposed to restrict the armor-piercing “M855 green tip” rifle bullet, saying its increasing use in handguns that could be concealed posed a threat to law enforcement officers.
abstract: Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives says it will shelve proposal to ban sale and manufacture of armor-piercing 5.56-millimeter 'M855 green tip' rifle bullet following intense opposition from Republican lawmakers and gun enthusiasts; agency had sought to outlaw bullets because their increasing use in concealable handguns poses threat to police officers.
lead_paragraph: The agency had proposed to restrict the armor-piercing “M855 green tip” rifle bullet, saying its increasing use in handguns that could be concealed posed a threat to law enforcement officers.

headline.main: A.T.F. Delays Plan to Ban Popular Type of Bullets
headline.print_headline: A.T.F. Delays Plan to Ban Popular Type of Bullets

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms
